definitions.definition: used before plural or uncountable nouns to mean ‘as many or as much as somebody needs or wants’

examples.text: Is there enough room for me?
I didn't have enough clothes to last a week.
Don't ask me to do it. I've got enough problems as it is.
There was food enough for all.

wordOrigin: Old English genōg, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch genoeg and German genug.
